summary: [Charts] Add support for Angular version 15+
[Charts] Add support for Angular version 15+
[Charts] Add gradient legend to treemap and sunburst series
[Charts] Unexpected fill when initialising a line series with visible=false
[Charts] New colour palettes
[Charts] Keep pie centred in series area despite collision avoidance
[Charts] When pie data includes negative values, colours do not display correctly. - Regression
[Charts] When a Category Axis is given numeric data, it is sorted numerically rather than in provided order
moreInformation:
As a workaround, you can change the numbers into strings by adding extra characters, and then remove these from the axis labels with a label formatter.
See example of this at https://plnkr.co/edit/jXyms52b8nq7GgkX?open=main.js

summary: [Charts] Stacked column not handling data with pos and neg values correctly - regression
[Charts] Incorrect groupPaddingInner behaviour
breakingChangesNotes: `axes[].groupPaddingInner` now only adds padding between grouped items. To add padding between groups, use `groupPaddingOuter`

summary: [Charts] Improve chart performance when showing many series (hundreds)
[Charts] Add label alignment options for treemap
[Charts] Pie chart not behaving correctly when some items have value of 0
[Charts] Histogram does not handle data updates correctly
[Charts] Add Radial Column series to charts
[Charts] Add Radial Bar series to charts
[Charts] Add Nightingale series to charts
[Charts] Allow adding error bars to charts
[Charts] Allow adding a background image to charts
[Charts] Allow hiding axis and grid lines
[Charts] Add radar series type to charts
[Charts] Add support for secondary axis for grouped column series
[Charts] Add support for Heatmap chart type
[Charts] Allow displaying a context menu when right-clicking a series marker
[Charts] Add a sunburst series type
[Charts] Add support for Range series types (range column, range bar, range area, range radar)
[Charts] Add box plot series type
[Charts] Add a waterfall series type for chart
[Charts] Allow zooming in and out of charts
[Charts] Add support for series animation in charts
[Tooltip] Allow tooltips to automatically refresh while being shown as the underlying data is updated
[Charts] Allow disabling collision avoidance on pie callout labels
[Charts] Scatter series labels appear bolder on series highlight
[Charts] Time-axis behaving inconsistently with non-London TZ
[Charts] Repeated ticks with time-axis using a single Date value errors
[Charts] BarSeries with time-axis using a single Date value errors
[Charts] setting showInLegend=false on one series is affecting all series previous to it
[Charts] Cannot specify per-series options for multiple bar/column/area series
breakingChangesNotes:
The implementation of BarSeries and AreaSeries for grouped and stacked cases no longer merges options for all related series together. The options for each series are now completely independent and won't bleed from one series to another.

This solves several bugs with options processing and independence of series configurations, however it may also break configurations that were leveraging this bug to reduce configuration points.

Additionally, each of these series now correctly has a unique `seriesId` value.

summary: [Charts] Allow complex object for data and series.data and datum keys to be property paths (xKey/yKey/etc)
[Charts] Grouped Category axis not redrawn correctly after data update
[Charts] When adding a series to an integrated pie chart created without series, an exception is thrown
[Charts] Remove global typescript definitions in zoom & tooltip
[Charts] Remove redundant AgAxisCategoryTickOptions.maxSpacing option
breakingChangesNotes: `AgAxisCategoryTickOptions.maxSpacing` has been immediately removed from our typings. This option never had any impact on axis tick selection, so this is considered a bugfix to the `AgAxisCategoryTickOptions` type.

summary: [Charts] Formatters maybe called several times per (re)render
breakingChangesNotes:
Chart formatter callbacks will now be deduplicated, with the intent being that we cache results for every unique permutation of parameters.

The result cache is cleared on an `AgChart.update()` or `AgChart.updateDelta()` call to allow for modifications to callback behaviour to be picked up.

summary: [Charts] Attempt to remove use of `eval()` due to increasing build tooling noise
[Charts] Toggling between Pie and Donut in ChartToolPanel causes getSeriesRect error
[Charts] Scatter point not visible when having the same X or Y
[Charts] Disable legend by default for single series cartesian charts
breakingChangesNotes: The legend is now hidden by default in cartesian charts with only one series. To show the legend, use `legend.enabled`.

summary: [Charts] Allow synchronising duplicate legend items to apply click action to both
[Charts] Allow Title, Subtitle and footnote to handle long text by truncating/wrapping
[Charts] Support reactive update of PieSeries innerRadiusOffset via API.
moreInformation:
Consider using `innerRadiusRatio`, added as part of `28.2.0` / `6.2.0` to avoid the need for reactive updates.
Even with `innerRadiusOffset` it is possible to use the `updateChart` method to update via API - see https://ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/integrated-charts-events/#event-driven-chart-updates

summary: [Charts] Add a formatter for charts axis title
[Charts] Add a label formatter to scatter, pie, treemap series
breakingChangesNotes: Removed deprecated `AgPieSeriesLabelFormatterParams.value` (deprecated since v6.2.0, AG Grid v28.2.0).

summary: [Chart] Allow wrapping treemap label values so they fit inside treemap tiles
[Charts] Allow to toggle axis labels on and off (instead of label formatters)
breakingChangesNotes: When `enabled` is set to false in an options object, all other configurations in that object will be ignored.

summary: [Charts] Allow displaying crosshairs (horizontal/vertical lines spanning the chart area) when hovering over the chart
[Charts] Pie breaks when data count increases
When opening the chart tool panel via API call, the affected chart is scrolled into view
[Charts] Add node / pointer tooltip position types
[Chart] Allow custom tooltips to remain visible to allow interacting with tooltip content for accessibility users
[Charts] Improve layout of pie chart callout labels to avoid overlapping chart or other labels
moreInformation: Pie-series callout label layout has been improved to attempt to avoid collisions. Consequently `calloutLabel.minAngle` now defaults to `0` since the previous default of `20` was primarily to help avoid label collisions.

summary: [Charts] Allow configuring tooltip position offset
[Charts] Line chart not implementing z index of series correctly
[Integrated Charts] Chart Tool Panel is not destroyed correctly leading to exceptions being thrown
[Charts] Add click near a point detection
deprecationNotes: AG Charts - Property [tooltip.tracking] is deprecated. Use [tooltip.range] instead.

summary: [Charts] Formatting incorrect for negative comma-grouped values
[Charts] Add ability to include chart footnotes
[Charts] Allow multi-line title and subtitle
[Charts] Allow option for padding at min and max of all axis types
[Charts] Add point series type to chart
moreInformation: This can be achieved with the scatter chart type.

summary: [Charts] Add double-click detection for event handlers
[Charts] Add a double-click event for legend items
[Charts] Allow displaying stacked and unstacked column series together in the same column group in charts
[Chart] Allow chart overlays to display "No Series" or "No Data" messages over the chart area
[Charts] Changing chart type drops listeners
[Charts] Switch legend item tooltips to use HTML tooltips
[Charts] Allow multi-line PieSeries labels
[Chart] Allow exporting standalone chart as an image
[Charts] Allow forcing the use of user-provided chart axis tick count settings
[Charts] Allow chart title and subtitle to apply chart padding from the outside edge, not between titles and chart area
breakingChangesNotes:
Chart padding is no longer applied between title/subtitle and chart area. Chart padding is now applied between outside edge of chart and the title. 

If you'd like to set the area between the title/subtitle and chart area, please set the title/subtitle spacing instead.

summary: [Charts] Allow legend to apply chart padding from the outside edge, not between legend and chart
breakingChangesNotes: Chart padding is no longer applied between legend and chart area. Chart padding is now applied between outside edge of chart and the legend. If you'd like to set the space between the legend and chart area, please set the legend spacing instead.

summary: [Charts] Allow turning off axis label skipping
[Charts] When using Log-axis, switching between base values, not all ticks have labels
[Charts] Treemap throws an exception when changing options object
[Charts] Out of memory issues in React with Safari on iOS
moreInformation:
This seems to be related to a WebKit bug: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=195325

We are considering adding some mitigations in an upcoming release to reduce memory use and add WebKit-specific workarounds to reduce the impact.

summary: [Charts] Add Treemap cell value label formatter
breakingChangesNotes: AgTreemapSeriesLabelsOptions.color has been replaced by AgTreemapSeriesLabelsOptions.value.key.

summary: [Charts] Add support for applying a delta options update and retrieving current options state
[Charts] When navigator scrolled custom markers change size
[Charts] When secondary axis visibility is toggled, it's rendered over the legend
[Chart] Automatically pad pie/doughnut chart so callout labels aren't clipped
[Charts] Remove legacy deprecated chart API members
breakingChangesNotes:
Removed support for properties deprecated before 27.0.0:

  • AgSeriesHighlightStyle - use same-named properties nested in the item property.
    • fill
    • stroke
    • strokeWidth
  • AgScatterSeriesOptions - use same-named properties nested in the marker property.
    • fill
    • stroke
    • strokeWidth
    • fillOpacity
    • strokeOpacity
  • AgAreaSeriesOptions - use multiple series entries and singular property names.
    • yKeys - use yKey instead.
    • yNames- use yName instead.
    • fills- use fill instead.
    • strokes- use stroke instead.
  • AgBarSeriesOptions - use multiple series entries and singular property names.
    • yKeys - use yKey instead.
    • yNames- use yName instead.
    • fills- use fill instead.
    • strokes- use stroke instead.

summary: [Chart] Allow disabling legend item click

moreInformation: Treemap `colorKey` can now point to a property containing a plain CSS colour value, without the need for `colorRange` or `colorDomain`.
breakingChangesNotes: AgTreemapSeriesOptions.colorParents has been removed - use a AgTreemapSeriesOptions.formatter instead for finer-grained non-leaf-node rendering control.

summary: [Chart] Allow configuration of the arrangement of the legend items to override smart auto arrangement

pieSeries.label property is now deprecated - please use pieSeries.calloutLabel instead.
pieSeries.labelKey property is now deprecated - please use pieSeries.calloutLabelKey instead.
pieSeries.labelName property is now deprecated - please use pieSeries.calloutLabelName instead.
pieSeries.callout property is now deprecated - please use pieSeries.calloutLine instead.

moreInformation:
Axis grid line styles already allow formatting the grid lines as shown here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/JtjFA9CBxfRvRu6U?open=main.js

Grid lines are not displayed when ticks aren't rendered because of axis label dropping. See here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-charts/axes/#label-rotation--skipping

summary: [Charts] Provide a tick formatter similar to labelFormatter
moreInformation:
AG Grid v27.3 adds automatic axis tick/label dropping so no tick formatter is needed. See:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-charts/axes/#label-rotation--skipping

summary: When using a pie chart and calling AgChart.update(), an exception is thrown

moreInformation: - Removed generic parameters from AgCartesianChartOptions, AgPolarChartOptions and AgHierarchyChartOptions interfaces.

summary: When displaying a chart with a time x-axis with data with the same X-value, using axis label format %H:%M displays 00:00 for all x-axis labels
When using line/scatter chart with data that only has Y=0 values, the Y-axis is not displayed
[Regression] When using chart line series with a time axis, displaying a series with a single data point compresses the x-range of all other series to a single value
[Charts] Add support for 'top' position to the Group Category Axis
[Regression] When using integrated charts, updating a large amount of data in the grid causes chart to briefly disappear
When displaying a stacked area series with negative data values normalised to 1 the Y-axis range includes positive values
When stacked area series is normalised to some values, it causes misplacement of a marker in the top left corner of the chart
[Regression] When using the integrated pivot chart with multiple line series, x-axis labels are repeated for every series
[Typing] Correct Chart Options
When the chart navigator is zoomed in and the chart is updated, column items are rendered outside of chart area
When the standalone chart data is updated, the current navigator position is reset
When showing multiple series in a doughnut chart, chart segments are not sized correctly and only their right halves get displayed
When using integrated charts to chart a column that doesn't have chartDataType: 'series' and has cell values including undefined/null, the chart displays a message 'No data available to be charted'
moreInformation:
If chartDataType in the column definition is not provided, AG Grid infers whether the data is numeric (for plotting as a series values), or not (for plotting as category values) based on the first row in the column. If the first row in this column doesn't contain a numeric value, it's treated as a category value which cannot be charted, as described here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/integrated-charts-range-chart/#inferred-by-the-grid

This is why please set chartDataType='series' on columns you want to chart in order to avoid cases where there's a null/undefined value in the first row, which infers the column as a category column and prevents it from charting.

summary: When using integrated charts with a grid with a bottom pinned row, the chart only renders an element to represent the first grid row, ignoring the remaining rows
When using stacked 100% chart type, having negative values in a stack causes its height to exceed 100%
When using integrated charting on pinned row data, the pinned row data isn't displayed in the chart
moreInformation:
Integrated charts do not support pinned rows. However, when no start row and end row are provided in the params to createRangeChart API method, the selected range in the grid by default includes pinned rows too as in sample above. 

Please provide the start/end row indexes in the params when creating the chart to reduce the selected cell range to exclude the pinned rows and thus only include the non-pinned rows which will be charted. These row index values can be computed based on the total row count minus the number of rows pinned at the top and bottom.

This approach is shown here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/oONsMWtMFuy7CuQM

This correctly displays the selected range to only the non-pinned rows which will be charted.

The default theme includes colors for 8 series. If you have more than 8 series, you can create your own theme with as many colours as you want. 

Here's how to add more colors to the palette:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-charts/themes/#making-custom-themes

moreInformation: The original request was made to make the legend say which column is plotted over which. Let's say 'sales vs month' and 'profits vs month', in case `month`, `sales` and `profits` columns were selected. This is now done automatically by the grid itself and no other use cases have been reported.

Charts API - Add support for extra and custom aggregations
moreInformation:
aggFunc: The aggregation function that should be applied to all series data. Built-in aggregation functions can be used by supplying one of the strings keys: sum, min, max, count, avg, first, last. Custom aggregation functions can also be directly supplied if they conform to the IAggFunc interface shown above.

Note that 'aggregate: boolean' has been replaced with aggFunc instead.
